yaml.title: Curriculum Design
yaml.subtitle:
Analysis of the module
Statistical Models

markdown.markdown:
::: {.content-hidden} $ {{< include macros.tex >}} $ ::: ::: footer
::: ## Micro Context {.smaller} - Module title: **Statistical Models** - Module Level: 2nd Year BSc Mathematics (L5) - Trimester: T2 - Class size: 20 Students - Format: 5h contact per week * 2 Lectures of 2h * Tutorial of 1h ## Micro Context {.smaller} ### Module Competencies |PCs | PC Summary | Rationale | |:--:|:-----------:|:------------:| |PC1 | Performing calculations | Study how Linear Models work | |PC2 | Solve mathematical problems | Study why Linear Models work | |PC3 | Solve real-world problems | Ability to analyse large datasets | |PC4 | Logical reasoning | Interpret results of Linear Models| |PC5 | Communication with experts and non-experts| How to report the findings | |PC7 | Using computer technology to obtain numerical solutions | How use Linear Models in tatistical software | |PC8 | Learning and working independently | Assessment promotes independent study | : {tbl-colwidths="[10,45,45]"} ## Micro Context {.smaller} ### Assessment Strategy - 10 weekly Worksheets - Portfolio of statistical analyses + discussion ## Meso Context {.smaller} This module builds on Probability and Statistics. We will study in particular linear models including linear regression and analysis of variance. A general understanding of the other foundational modules such as Calculus and Linear Algebra is also necessary. This module is part of the pathway that focusses on computational methods and the analysis of data. It is followed by Numerical Computation in Python and Data Science. Indeed, both are aspects of this module since part of this module focusses on using statistical software to use the statistical models we analyse. The Data Science module that follows later in this pathway builds on the techniques learned here. - PC1: Performing calculations and manipulating equations in core areas of mathematics and some more advanced topics ## Meso Context ## Macro Context # Theme:
Assessment &
Feedback Design {background-color="#cc0164" visibility="uncounted"} ::: footer
::: ## IEF Assessment & Feedback Checklist ## Inclusive Assessment, Marking & Feedback Policy ## Exploration via Constructive Alignment # Theme:
Inclusive &
Decolonised Curricula {background-color="#cc0164" visibility="uncounted"} ::: footer
::: ## Approach for evaluation ## Highlights of Analysis **Good examples identified** - one **Areas of Enhancement** - two ## Recommended Enhancements - For more details see Reference 1 in the [Annotated Bibliography](/files/annotated_bibliography.pdf) # Theme:
Sustainable Curricula {background-color="#cc0164" visibility="uncounted"} ::: footer
::: ## Approach for evaluation ## Highlights of Analysis **Good examples identified** - one **Areas of Enhancement** - two ## Recommended Enhancements - For more details see Reference 2 in the [Annotated Bibliography](/files/annotated_bibliography.pdf) # Theme:
Global Curricula {background-color="#cc0164" visibility="uncounted"} ::: footer
::: ## Approach for evaluation ## Highlights of Analysis **Good examples identified** - one **Areas of Enhancement** - two ## Recommended Enhancements - For more details see Reference 3 in the [Annotated Bibliography](/files/annotated_bibliography.pdf) ## Contact details - **Lecturer:** Dr. Silvio Fanzon - **Call me:** * Silvio * Dr. Fanzon - **Email:** S.Fanzon@hull.ac.uk - **Office:** Room 104a, Larkin Building - **Office hours:** Wednesday 12:00-13:00 - **Meetings**: in my office or send me an Email ## Questions - If you have any questions please feel free to ``email me`` - We will address ``Homework`` and ``Coursework`` in class - In addition, please do not hesitate to attend ``office hours`` ## Lectures Each week we have - 2 Lectures of 2h each - 1 Tutorial of 1h | Session | Date | Place | |---------------|------------------|-------------------| | Lecture 1 | Wed 10:00-12:00 | Wilberforce LR 22 | | Lecture 2 | Thu 15:00-17:00 | Wilberforce LR 10 | | Tutorial | Thu 11:00-12:00 | Wilberforce LR 7 | ## Assessment This course will be assessed as follows:
|**Type of Assessment** | **Percentage of final grade** | |:----- |:----- | | Coursework Portfolio | 70% | | Homework | 30% | ## Rules for Coursework - Coursework available on Canvas from Week 3 - We will discuss coursework exercises in class - Coursework must be submitted on **[Canvas](https://canvas.hull.ac.uk/courses/70065)** - Deadline: **14:00 on Thursday 2nd May** ## Rules for Homework - 10 Homework papers, posted weekly on **[Canvas](https://canvas.hull.ac.uk/courses/70065)** - Each Homework paper is worth 14 points - Final Homework grade computation: * Sum the top 7 scores (max score 98 points) * Bonus 2 points will be added to the final score - Homework papers must be submitted on **[Canvas](https://canvas.hull.ac.uk/courses/70065)** - Deadlines: **14:00 on Mondays** ## License {.smaller} ::: {.column width="60%"} This work is licensed under [CC BY-NC-ND 4.0](http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-nd/4.0/) ::: ::: {.column width="38%"} ![](/by-nc-nd.png){width=2in} ::: For attribution please cite this work as: > Fanzon, Silvio (2024). *Slides on Curriculum Design*. [https://www.silviofanzon.com/2024-Curriculum-Design-Slides/](https://www.silviofanzon.com/2024-Curriculum-Design-Slides/) BibTex citation: ```bibtex @electronic{Fanzon-Curriculum-Design-2024, author = {Fanzon, Silvio}, title = {Slides on Curriculum Design}, url = {https://www.silviofanzon.com/2024-Curriculum-Design-Slides/}, year = {2024}} ``` ::: footer [Contact Me](https://www.silviofanzon.com/contact) :::
